arts.ttl: Sunderland 2-1 Sheffield United: United Stunned By First Half Sunderland Surge
arts.sum: Sheffield United began 2025 with a disappointing 2-1 defeat away at Sunderland. The Blades had a great opportunity to open the scoring when they earned a penalty inside the first 15 minutes, but Kieffer Moore’s tame effort was saved. Shortly after, the home side nudged in front from a clinical Eliezer Mayenda strike into the […] The post Sunderland 2-1 Sheffield United: United Stunned By First Half Sunderland Surge appeared first on Sheff United Way.

arts.ttl: Sunderland close in on leaders after Isidor strike sees off Sheffield United
arts.athr: Louise Taylor at the Stadium of Light
arts.sum: Wilson Isidor, Eliezer Mayenda, Jobe Bellingham and the rest of Régis Le Bris’s vibrant young side are not about to give up on automatic promotion quite yet. This statement victory, secured thanks to Isidor’s fine winning goal, not merely preserved Sunderland’s unbeaten home record in the Championship this season but kept them fourth, only two points and one place behind a suddenly mortal-looking Sheffield United. Three games without a win have left Chris Wilder’s team three points in arrears of the leaders, Leeds, and trailing second-placed Burnley on goal difference. But, after missing an early penalty, they more than played their part in an enthralling night of new year drama. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Sunderland overcome Sheff Utd with statement win in promotion hunt
arts.sum: Sunderland began the year with a statement 2-1 victory against promotion rivals Sheffield United at the Stadium of Light, ending a 20-year run without a league victory against the Blades.

arts.ttl: ‘Without regrets’ – Player’s decision to not leave Sunderland paying off, ends up convincing Regis Le Bris
arts.sum: Towards the end of the summer window, we covered claims which stated Adil Aouchiche was keen on leaving Sunderland. It was also said the 22-year-old was looking for a club that will allow him to flourish, but a deal never took shape.
